Package it.disi.unitn

Class FFMpegBuilder

java.lang.Object
it.disi.unitn.FFMpegBuilder
public class FFMpegBuilder extends Object
Builder class for convenience class FFMpeg

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FFMpegBuilder(@NotNull String ffmpegPath)
    This constructor initializes the class with the path to ffmpeg's command line utility and the command to be executed.

    • FFMpegBuilder

      public FFMpegBuilder(@NotNull @NotNull String ffmpegPath) throws NotEnoughArgumentsException
      This constructor initializes the class with the path to ffmpeg's command line utility and the command to be executed.
      Parameters:
      ffmpegPath - The relative path to ffmpeg's command line utility
      Throws:
      NotEnoughArgumentsException - when one or both of this constructor's arguments are set to null

      public FFMpeg build()
      Creates a new FFMpeg instance using the information given to this FFMpegBuilder instance.
      Returns:
      The created FFMpeg instance

      Convenience method to get the ffmpeg command to be executed.
      Returns:

      Adds the path to an input file to the command to be executed.

    • newTracksMerger

      public TracksMerger newTracksMerger(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile, @NotNull @NotNull String audioInput, @NotNull @NotNull String videoInput) throws NotEnoughArgumentsException
      Create a new TracksMerger instance given a video output file and an audio and a video input file.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The given video output file
      audioInput - The given audio input file
      videoInput - The given video input file
      Returns:
      The newly created TracksMerger instance
      Throws:
      NotEnoughArgumentsException - when the TracksMerger's constructor throws this exception

    • newTracksMerger

      public TracksMerger newTracksMerger(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile) throws NotEnoughArgumentsException
      This method performs the same action as newTracksMerger(String, String, String), but it should be used only when creating the final output video.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The path to the output file
      Returns:
      The newly created TracksMerger instance
      Throws:
      NotEnoughArgumentsException - when the TracksMerger's constructor throws this exception

    • newVideoCreator

      public VideoCreator newVideoCreator(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile, @NotNull @NotNull String inputFolder, @NotNull @NotNull String pattern) throws NotEnoughArgumentsException
      Returns a new VideoCreator instance given the path to the output file and a non-null list of paths to the input images.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The path to the output file
      inputFolder - The non-null path to the folder containing the input images
      pattern - The pattern that specifies the names of the files to be included in the output video. This path has to be ffmpeg-compatible, and it must include the file extensions.
      Returns:
      A new VideoCreator instance
      Throws:
      NotEnoughArgumentsException - when at least one of the given arguments is null

    • addAllInputs

      public void addAllInputs(@NotNull @NotNull String @NotNull ... inputFiles) throws NotEnoughArgumentsException
      Same as for addInput(), but this can add multiple files. Throws NotEnoughArgumentsException if the input value is null or if one of the input values is null.
      Parameters:
      inputFiles - The list of paths of the input files to be added to the command
      Throws:
      NotEnoughArgumentsException - when one of the arguments given to this method is null

    • addOutput

      public void addOutput(@NotNull @NotNull String outputFile)
      Adds the path of an output file to the command.
      Parameters:
      outputFile - The path of the output file to be added

    • setVideoFrameSize

      public void setVideoFrameSize(@NotNull @NotNull String sizeID)
      Sets the video frame size from the given sizeID. See here for the recognized size IDs.
      Parameters:
      sizeID - The given size ID

    • setVideoFrameSize

      public void setVideoFrameSize(int width, int height)
      Sets the video frame size on the given width and height parameters.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the frame
      height - The height of the frame
